heading: Conduct of hearing by office of administrative trials and hearings
text:
The hearing shall be conducted by the office of
administrative trials and hearings. The administrative law judge assigned to hear the matter shall submit his or her proposed findings
of fact and recommended decision to the commissioner. If based on such recommended decision, proposed findings of fact, and the
record of the hearing the commissioner determines that the building or part thereof or vacant land is a public nuisance, pursuant to
this article, the commissioner may issue an order of closure. Such order shall not bar legally required ingress or egress for residential
occupancy of parts of the building that are not subject to the order of closure.
